channel.title: Examples on wizzy - cli for Grafana
channel.description: Recent content in Examples on wizzy - cli for Grafana

item.title: Examples
item.description:
Examples

We have a wide list of examples of uses cases which will guide you to use wizzy efficiently.

item.title: Store Dashboards in Git
item.description:
1. Download wizzy and initialize the directory with git as specified in the instructions. Instructions are here - Installation

  2. Set Grafana properties if not set already:

    $ wizzy set grafana url http://localhost:3000
$ wizzy set grafana username admin
$ wizzy set grafana username password

  3. Import all Grafana dashboards:

    $ wizzy import dashboards

  4. Check into Git the dashboards directory:

    $ git add dashboards
$ git commit -m "Initial dashboards commit"

You dashboards are stored in local Git repo. You may choose to push it to any remote branch now!

item.title: Store Dashboards in AWS S3
item.description:
1. Download wizzy and initialize the directory with git as specified in the instructions. Instructions are here - Installation

  2. Set Grafana properties if not set already:

    $ wizzy set grafana url http://localhost:3000
$ wizzy set grafana username admin
$ wizzy set grafana username password

  3. Import all Grafana dashboards:

    $ wizzy import dashboards

  4. Have you aws config stored at its standard location ~/.aws/config

  5. Set S3 Bucket name.

    $ wizzy set s3 bucket_name grafana-setup
$ wizzy upload to-s3 dashboards

You dashboards are stored have been uploaded to AWS S3 now!
